703316f-d.title: Brooklyn: Brighton Beach Avenue - Coney Island Avenue
703316f-d.text:
(1)
Brighton Beach Ave., south side, between Coney Island Ave., and East
4th Street, showing a northwest view of the Brighton Beach Music Hall,
and a part of the Brighton Beach Hotel.
December 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Cellection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
(2)
The same, a view northeast.
December 192i.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
(3)
The same, showing the Reigelmann Boardwalk, to the right of which is
the site of the Brighton Beach Hotel.
November 25, 1924.

MAY BE REPRODUCED.
(4)
The same, showing another view of the hotel site and the Reigelmann
Boardwalk.
November 25, 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

703326f-c.title: Brooklyn: Brighton Beach Avenue - Coney Island Avenue
703326f-c.text:
(1)
Brighton Beach Ave., south side, between Coney Island Ave., and East
4th Street, showing the Brighton Beach Hotel, which was 460 feet long by
200 feet deep, 3 to 4-stories high, and at its four towere from 6 to 7.
stories.
About 1901.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
(2)
The same, a view northeast.
About 1901.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
(3)
The same, viewed south fromm the Brighton Beach subway station, elevs-
te4 at this point.
March 31, 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
(4)
The same, showing the hotel demolished, with the Music Hall soo
to follow.
July 15, 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

703330f-d.text:
(1)
Brighton Beach Ave., south side, between East 4th Street and Coney
Island Ave., showing a view, taken from the Culver Line platform,
looking southeast, of the Brighton Beach Hotel being demolished.
Standing alone but once connected with the hotel is the Brighton Beach
Musio Hall.
July 1S, 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
(2)
The same, demolished.
November 25, 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
(3)
The same.
November 25, 1984.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
(4)
The same, showing partially cleared site of the hotel and a view
eastward.
November 25, 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE RER ODUCED.
